title: Inconsistent behaviour of the **exclude** option.
body:
In GitLab by @Indigofera_Tinctoria on Oct 15, 2018, 12:48

Related issues #450 #392 #393 

## Flake8 Installation

```shell
pipenv install --dev flake8
```

## flake8 --bug-report

```json
{
  "dependencies": [
    {
      "dependency": "setuptools",
      "version": "40.4.3"

  ],
  "platform": {
    "python_implementation": "CPython",

  },

  "version": "3.5.0"
```

## Problem description

Inconsistent behaviour of the `exclude` option. This is a minor problem (for me) when checking a commit in git, specifically when working on a Django project.

## Report

| Command | Result |
|---|---|
|`flake8 --exclude=some_app/migrations/0001_initial.py some_app/migrations/0001_initial.py`| Works as expected, ignoring the input file `0001_initial.py`|
|`flake8 --exclude=migrations some_app/migrations/0001_initial.py`| It will check the file anyway despite the "exclude" option. *I expect flake8 to ignore the file*|
|`flake8 --exclude=migrations some_app/`| Works as expected, ignoring the `migrations/` folder|
